intro: Arrabidaea stenothyrus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, often with a distinctive darker throat. Its leaves are typically velvety and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in indoor conditions with proper care.
